bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 14, [1901]

div1.p: Lawrence Reed responds to family news. His friend Cooke visits Washington.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 14, [1901]
div1.p:
I received your
letter of Sunday yesterday morning
before I was out of bed and
I enjoyed hearing from you
so much- I am delighted
that Blossom had such a
good time at the Naval Acdmy
and hope she will be able
to visit there again- I
know you will be glad to
have Father return to Wash,
after almost 3 months duty in
Cuba- I wonder where he
will go next.

So Cooke called and
you thought him nice- Well
he is one of the nicest men
I know and I regret very
much that he has been ordered
to Phila on recruiting service
for he probably will not
return for 3 or 4 months-

In answer to your questions
about the cake and pkg from
W. and L. I am sure I wrote
you that I have received the
cake but of course it will
not reach you before Wednesday
of this week- But I have
not seen or heard of any pkg from W. and L. I am
sorry you sent it by express- I thought I
told you how to send things but perhaps I
forgot to, always send them in care of the
Transportation Quartermaster. Pier 22 Brooklyn
N.Y. send them by express to that point Express
prepaid -- and no other charges will be
made and we get very quick delivery as
we have two transports a months. Let
me know over what line you sent it
and what line in Cuba received it and I
will trace it- Also notify the express Co
in Wash that it has not been received and
for Kean to look it up- Of course I will get
it in time but when is the question

We are going out to pay our respects to
an American planter this afternoon so will
tell you all about it this week- So many people
have died lately- had a letter from Lilian
Cragin and she told me of
her Grandmother's death also of
Mrs Greeulu's -- and of poor
Uncle Joe Davis- I have
also heard that Fitz
Mennegrode had gone to
the dogs- Such a pitty
for a nice bright fellow
like Fitz to be so weak.

Tell me all the news
when you write -- & with
best love for all-
